abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio says in radio interview that animal rights supporters should try to convince City Council members to vote for bill that would end Central Park horse-carriage industry; has been unable to fulfill campaign promise to ban carriage horses due to pushback from councilmembers.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio, who promised during his campaign to end the Central Park carriage industry, said during a radio interview that advocates should use their energy to solidify votes in the Council.

headline.main: City Council Stands in Way of Carriage Horse Ban, de Blasio Tells Activists
headline.print_headline: Mayor Faults Council on Carriage Horse Bill

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio, who promised during his campaign to end the Central Park carriage industry, said during a radio interview that advocates should use their energy to solidify votes in the Council.
